intro: Coccocypselum hispidulum, commonly known as the rough coccocypselum, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native habitat.
